item1_summary:
AMETEK is a leading global manufacturer of electronic instruments and electromechanical devices . Its predecessor was originally incorporated in Delaware in 1930 under the name American Machine and Metals, Inc. Its products are marketed and sold worldwide through two operating groups: Electronic Instruments (EIG) and Electromechanical (EMG)
 EMG holds significant positions in niche segments of the aerospace and defense, automation and medical markets . AMETEK believes it has certain technological advantages over its competitors that allow it to maintain its leading market positions . Historically, the Company has demonstrated an ability to develop innovative new products and solutions that support customer needs .
 The management team is focused on delivering strong, consistent and profitable growth . Individual performance is tied to financial results through Company-established stock ownership guidelines and equity incentive programs . AMETEK’s Growth Model integrates the four growth strategies of Operational Excellence, Strategic Acquisitions, Global and Market Expansion, and New Product Development with a focus on cash generation and capital deployment .
 Since the beginning of 2020 through December 31, 2024, AMETEK has completed 14 acquisitions with annualized sales totaling approximately $1.4 billion . Acquisitions have played a key role in achieving synergies with newly acquired companies . The company's mix of businesses has shifted toward those that offer better opportunities for growth and profitability .
 In 2024, the Company achieved record sales of $6,941.2 million, an increase of 5.2% from 2023 . The Company posted record sales, operating income, net income, diluted earnings per share, and operating cash flow . AMETEK is committed to paying a consistently increasing cash dividend .
 AmetEK spent $117.5 million in cash in October 2024, net of cash acquired, to purchase Virtek Vision International, a leading provider of advanced laser-based projection and inspection systems . Arnings per share for 2024 were a record $5.93, an increase of $0.26 or 4.5% .
 51% of EIG’s net sales were to customers outside the United States . EIG supplies the aerospace industry with aircraft sensors, monitoring systems, embedded computing systems, power supplies, fuel and fluid measurement systems, and data acquisition systems . At December 31, 2024, EIG employed approximately 11,600 people, of whom approximately 900 were covered by collective bargaining agreements .
 Virtek is a leading provider of advanced laser-based projection and inspection systems . Its instruments are used for precision measurement in a number of applications, including radiation detection, trace element and materials analysis, nanotechnology research, ultraprecise manufacturing, advanced optical metrology, and test and measurement . Virtek's advanced 3D laser projectors, smart cameras, and quality control inspection systems complement the Company's existing Creaform business capabilities .
 AMETEK’s aerospace products are designed to customer specifications and manufactured to stringent operational and reliability requirements . Products include airborne data systems, turbine engine temperature measurement products, vibration-monitoring systems, cockpit instruments and displays, fuel and fluid measurement products . The company also provides spare part sales, repairs and overhaul services to commercial aerospace .
 Approximately 6% of EIG’s 2024 net sales were made to its five largest customers . No single customer comprises more than 2% of net sales . EIG is not dependent on any single customer such that the loss of that customer would have a material adverse effect on EIG's operations . EMG is a leader in many of the niche markets in which it competes .
 In 2024, 41% of EMG’s net sales were to customers outside the United States . At December 31, 2024, EMG employed approximately 9,500 people, of whom approximately 2,300 were covered by collective bargaining agreements . EMG also shares operating facilities with EIG in China, Serbia, and Mexico .
 Paragon expands the Company's presence in the MedTech space and provides access to new market segments with strong growth rates . Approximately 14% of EMG’s 2024 net sales were made to its five largest customers . EIG makes use of specialized distributors and sales representatives to market its products along with a direct sales force for its technically sophisticated products .
 AMETEK believes it ranks as a leader in certain analytical measurement and control instruments, and power and industrial markets . It also is a major instrument and sensor supplier to commercial aviation . The Company's operations and properties are subject to laws and regulations relating to environmental protection, including those governing air emissions, water discharges, waste management, and workplace safety .
 The Company has a robust Environmental Health and Safety program responsible for supporting its environmental monitoring and compliance efforts . The Company is required to conform our operations and properties to these laws and adapt to regulatory requirements in all countries as these requirements change . The discovery of previously unknown contamination or the imposition of new requirements could increase costs or subject AMETEK to new or increased liabilities .
 AMETEK is committed to providing a consistent and excellent return to our stakeholders, all while maintaining a strong commitment to environmental stewardship, social responsibility, inclusion, and sound corporate governance . We believe that effectively prioritizing and managing our sustainability initiatives will help create long-term value and a better future for our stakeholders .
 AMETEK is committed to developing an inclusive culture to help power innovation, growth, and greater opportunities for all employees . We are continually expanding our employee development, engagement, and training initiatives to provide meaningful opportunities for personal and professional development . We cultivate strong and lasting relationships with communities in which we operate, actively contributing to their social and economic prosperity .
 Human Capital Management has created a leadership development program for employees on track to become P&L leaders in the company . Giving back to the community is an important part of our culture, and we partner to strengthen the work of non-profit charities around the world . We have a long-standing commitment to responsible corporate conduct .
 As of December 31, 2024, we have approximately 21,500 employees . Our compensation programs are designed to provide competitive salaries and benefit programs to attract, retain and motivate a world-class world class . We strive to protect health and safety in every aspect of our enterprise – from the way we design, manufacture and deliver our products to the way our customers use them .
 AMETEK has posted in the “Investors – Governance” section of its website its corporate governance guidelines, Board committee charters, codes of ethics, and social and environmental policies . Those documents also are available free of charge in published form to any stockholder who requests them by writing to the Investor Relations Department .
